message:
A New Year brings with it new horizons for growth and prosperity. It gives everyone a chance to start afresh. 

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy New Year 2018 and we hope that 2018 becomes the year when the Indian Startups become the crown glory of the Indian Economy!

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — with Zone Startups/India.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur recently organised the first ever edition of its Lean Startup Drive in the startup city of India- Bengaluru, in association with Skillenza and Zone Startups/India Adopting lean startup methodologies for an early stage startup is vital, the mantras of developing a Minimum Viable Product(MVP) were given by eminent entrepreneurs like Rohith Veerajappa and Manik Choudhary. A number of startups including Swatronix, NayaGaadi and Zingo Hotels were also present, in what turned out to be a really amazing local startups meet. 
#LSD2k18
#Bengaluru

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit 
The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving 

Stage 2: Product-Market Fit 
The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model 

Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market 
Here, your main objective is to SCALE. 

We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. Adopting Lean startup methodologies is very essential for any early stage startup.
To develop MVP(Minimum Viable Product), Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Drive. 
Learn the mantras of excelling with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: ecell-iitkgp.org/lsd

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-
Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving.
Stage 2: Product-Market Fit The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model.
Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market Fit your objective is to SCALE. 
We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. A major chunk of startups do not follow the Lean-startup principle during their growth period.
To solve these, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Machine Workshop.
Learn the mantras of excelling in each stage with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: www.ecell-iitkgp.org/lsm

Another year comes to an end. In the Indian startup ecosystem, a lot of businesses flourished, while some failed terribly this year. A lot of people were involved in making these businesses big, and a mammoth amount of money was spent to fund these ventures.
Lets take a look at the people who mattered the most in 2017 and how they changed the Indian startup ecosystem for what it is at the end of 2017-

P.S: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 11th Edition of its annual corporate summit- The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018. For more information, visit:-www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message:
The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. 
Infinity War ushers in the beginning of an end, of sorts, for the MCU. The mystery and intrigue of the infinity stones have enthralled the audience for long. And finally, the saga is coming to an end. Similarly, Global Entrepreneurship Summit is a culmination of our yearlong initiatives for the benefit of the start-up culture in our country. Witness a meet of intellectuals and entrepreneurs from across the country and get a chance to grow. 
Register now at - www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/register

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation from Prodex, Technology Transfer Group, RGSOIPL and RMoSEE. The speaker, Mr. Kameshwar Eranki, Founder and CEO, VajraSoft Inc.,USA, threw light on the impact  of disruptive technologies on future markets and the ease of management of one's Intellectual Property through technological advancements. 
Additionally, a hands-on demo was shown to the participants in areas of Reverse Engineering, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping.

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Sahil Joshi and Shail Daswani.
message:
"A true entrepreneur is a doer, not a dreamer". Such entrepreneurs like Richa Singh, Venky Iyer, Dinesh Chandwani, & many more graced the Nagpur Chapter of Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive 2017 with their presence. Through their Talks & Guest lectures, the audience realised the efforts & hardships one has to face, to become a true entrepreneur!
#EAD2k17
#EAD_Nagpur

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message:
Recently, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur organized "E-adda" in Gargi Auditorium & the prime objective of the whole event was to come up with several solutions in order to improvise the Startup culture in the campus. Mr. Arnav Kumar(AVP, SAIF Partners) suggested some interactive measures that must be undertaken in order to increase the participation of the on campus students in such activities. Some operational startups of the campus were also present & they got their share of advice from Mr. Arnav Kumar. Overall, it was a very enriching session & with the suggestions provided in the Startup Culture Survey form, we would definitely come up with new initiatives so as to create an enterprising environment in the campus! 
Have a look at the Startup Survey Analysis!

Recently we conducted a Startup Culture Survey of Kharagpur. We have received a lot of constructive and innovative responses, and with the analysis of the responses, we are conducting the first session of E-Adda, where current startups of IIT Kharagpur and future budding entrepreneurs get together and discuss. the various initiatives and improvements to be done in IIT Kharagpur for improving entrepreneurship culture in the campus.
We also have Mr. Arnav Kumar( AVP, Saif Partners and an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur) presiding over the event, helping us to get a better retrospection of the improvement initiatives we discuss.
Date - 4/11/2017
Time  - 9.00 pm
Venue - Gargi Auditorium
Be there!

Time - 10 am onwards
Venue - Nalanda Complex

Inshorts, Swiggy, Runnr, TVF- we all have heard about these Startups who are currently making it big in the Indian Startup Ecosystem. The people who have shaped these startups were once a part of the KGP Family, and they hustled everyday in order to turn their idea into a reality. They believed to be the game changers and decided to leave their secure jobs to face the odd struggles that every new entrant faces. 
But lately, IIT Kharagpur has seen a surprising drop in the number of operational startups and for the same reason, we want you to take this survey. This will help us to analyse different reasons why students are not starting up and the problems that the current start-up cofounders are facing in the campus. Ultimately, we will come up with some solutions that will surely have an impact on the current scenario.

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
E-commerce has changed the way we shop for products. On the other hand, companies like Philips have brought in a revolution in smart home lighting, thereby changing the way we light up our houses. 
In our series of "Celebrating Unconventionality", Mr. Jeyendran Venugopal(CTO, Myntra) & Mr. Rajeev Chopra(Ex-CEO, Philips) will share the impact of technology in the current Consumer Internet Space & the cut throat marketing strategies that are used in order to stay at the top!
Catch them live at Kalidas Auditorium tomorrow!
Time: 5:00 PM
Be There!
#EAD2k17
#EADKGP
#Celebrating_Unconventionality

Bitcoin is different than any currency you’ve used before, so it's very important to understand some key points. Unlike government issued money that can be inflated at will, the supply of Bitcoin is mathematically limited to twenty one million bitcoins and that can never be changed. 
In our series of "Celebrating the Unconventional", Mr. Sharan Nair(VP, Unocoin) will share the technological, social & economic aspects of Bitcoin & the reasons why it can possibly replace the currencies in our pockets!
Catch him Live at Kalidas Auditorium on 15th October during EAD Kharagpur!
Time: 5:00 PM

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organizing a Workshop on Entrepreneurship Promotion. Professor Larry Cox of Pepperdine University ( USA ) will conduct this workshop.

It is a two-day workshop with timings as below:

 9th of October: 6 pm - 8.30 pm 
 10th of October: 6 pm - 7.30 pm

The components of the workshop include Increasing Creative Capacity and Creative Problem Solving Process. Professor Larry Cox has expressed interest in sponsoring the travel to USA for few students of IIT Kharagpur in connection with Product and Entrepreneurship Promotion based on certain criteria that would be decided after these interactions.

Please fill out this form (http://tinyurl.com/ecell-workshop) by 10 am on 7th October 2017. Selected people will be intimated by email by 7th October 2017 itself.

Students will get participating certificate and are all invited for the high tea at the closing on each day. Please note that the attendance is compulsory for both(9th and 10th October 2017) days.

In addition to the team, Google will also have access to HTC's intellectual property to support the Pixel smartphone family.

After fintech company Capital Float and Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori's cure.fit, budget-hotel tech company, Treebo Hotels has raised Series C funding of $34 million led by Hong-Kong based investment firms Ward Ferry Management and Karst Peak Capital. Existing investors SAIF Partners, Bertelsmann India Investments and Matrix Partners also participated in the round.
The funds are said to be used for building budget hotels, improving customer experience and expansion.

After weeks of resignation of former Uber CEO Travis Kalanick, Uber will appoint Expedia's Dara Khosrowshahi as the new CEO to steer head the global ride-hailing leviathan. 
Dara Khosrowshahi will face a number of hurdles as Uber, which has raised more than $15 billion from private investors, navigates its way toward a still-unscheduled initial public offering and a high-stakes trade secrets suit filed by Alphabet's Waymo.

After the resignation of Vishal Sikka from Infosys, Nandan Nilekani has been appointed as the non-executive Chairman of the Board.
This appointment is being seen as the best choice for Infosys for the coming days, after years of internal management bouts plaguing the company. Hopefully, Nandan Nilekani will be able to steer Infosys to a position of former strength until a new CEO is appointed in the next financial year.
